Prepare for the essay

Probably one of my favorite cards in downfall, the effect is really strong if you can support it, though doing so takes some serious effort. Once you get this up and running, it can allow you to have some insane output, which is especially good in downfall because there are so few mechanics that punish spamming cheap cards. The big drawback here is that it costs 2 energy to get in play, and is usually going to be rather slow to get started (though you can trigger this effect on the same turn you cast stasis engine with a strong enough setup, making it effectively only cost 1 energy and becoming draw neutral). Fortunately, guardian has some really good tools to buy time for this to start working with it's many strong block cards and defensive mode, which means that it can even be pretty good in medium length fights. It really shines in the later acts, since you will usually have a better stasis setup and synergy package for this by then, and the effect will be more meaningful since fights are longer, giving you more time to benefit from the scaling. This is usually going to get punished in act 2 by the very fast and dangerous hallway/elite fights. 

The most notable synergies to support this are planning, aquamarine, fragmented gem, emergency, compile package, exploit gems, sentry blast, orb support, mummified hand, and bottled anomaly. Being able to get lots of cards into stasis quickly really helps, as that's one easy way to play lots of 0 cost cards on the same turn, and you can also use accelerate cards like speed boost to get them out of stasis faster. Putting aquamarine and fragmented gem into 0 cost cards with sockets can be a very easy way to reliably trigger this effect, especially if you can loop them with reroute/recover. There are plenty of guardian decks that won't be able to support this card, so be careful before snapping it up, especially if you are still early in the run and don't have many of the right tools yet, it can be very clunky in act 1/2.

The upgrade is very interesting, most of the time it will be a bad idea. This is a card you would really rather draw on turn 4/5 most of the time, so that you already have a stasis setup going, and thus have a better chance of proccing the draw/energy on the turn you cast it. However, if you do have the right kind of setup to reliably trigger this on turn 1, making it innate can give you tons of acceleration and consistency throughout your fights and carry a run. Orb support can really help make that happen, as can a bottled lightning on certain skills (0 cost ones, ones with sockets set to aquamarine and fragmented gem). You can also more freely upgrade this to innate if you have guardian gear or other relics that help smooth out your turn 1's like lantern, red mask, bag of preparation, or anchor. It can also be a great situational upgrade when you are heading into late act 3/act 4. Most of the fights within that late game boss gauntlet are slow enough to not punish making this innate, and all of them benefit from getting it down turn 1 so that you can start proccing it ASAP. I kind of love how weird/interesting the decision to upgrade this card is, as it's often incorrect, but very rewarding when you find the right spot for it.

Wow I think I'm gonna be the black sheep here. I think the card is not that good. It's a 2 cost power that (likely) does nothing the turn you play it, and doesn't activate every turn, and requires you to play 3 zero cost cards for it to activate and... give you more energy? Requires a lot of draw and 0 costs to work but then my argument is... is this necessary? Stasis already works as alt card draw kinda. In stasis heavy decks I feel like the energy is wasted, and even in decks where you can consistently activate it, it still is very slow.

compared to floating orbs this is rarer, activates a finite amount of times, more expensive, can not activate if you play less than 3 zero cost cards, and arguably a worse effect. I think this card is just a really strange crutch and I'm unsure why it is as popular as it is.

and lastly, necessity. This does really bad in short fights and not good in medium length fights. However short fights, especially in acts 1 and 2 is where Guardian struggles the most, and incidentally where this card struggles the most.
It's a win more card that doesn't do a great job at making you win more and does absolutely nothing to cover any of guardian's weaknesses.

Also it's a classic case of a power with a really bad upgrade that actively hurts the card. Sure not needing an upgrade is a positive, but this one is so bad that it being upgraded makes it actively worse for most situations. You won't have cards coming out of stasis so you won't be able to activate it nearly as easily.

I agree that floating orbs is better then this card, but this is still good since you should still be expected to play at least 3 0 cost cards each turn in any deck that wants this. Drawing an extra card a turn and having an extra energy is pretty strong when you can get both effects on a single card. Guardian acutally has very little energy generation, its mostly relying on stasis to make cards free.
I feel like this card is a "sometimes" card, but the kind where if you want to have it you really want to have it. In decks that like this it's +1 draw and energy per turn.
I do feel like alot of the time I can't take it, cause Act 1 it sucks and if my deck isn't great in act 2 i can't take it or I'll die

I'm fine with upgrading this to be innate. You can leave it unupgraded until the endgame where you can then upgrade it to have it on turn 1 ageist the last few fights; or just leave it unupgraded until act 4 and upgrade it then to use it ageist neow. Plus decks that have relics that give them 0 cost cards (tiny bowler hat and sharpened fragment are the main ones) can upgrade this at any time really.
You cannot really make this upgrade to anything else besides making it innate, reducing the cards cost would be too good and so would letting it draw more cards or give more energy
Really good with mummified hand, had a run like that the other day
